channel.title: automation on Gerald
channel.description: Recent content in automation on Gerald

item.title: Website Makefile
item.description: Computers and software are wonderful things, instead of remembering to: Ensure all node packages are installed and/or up-to-date Compile css bits Generate the resume: markdown -> laTex -> laTex -> PDF Compile the static hugo site Add all of the changed files to the git repo Insert a helpful commit message to remember the work that was done Push the changes to master In particular, I always seem to forget step 5 and end up with missing files since everything wasn’t appropriately staged before the commit.
